info.name: Imbued One
info.description: Imbued One for Sorcerers from Pexia's Guide to Omeria

description.p: Imbued ones have a lot in common with Hands of the Eight. Both draw their power from one or more of the eight arcane energies of the Cosmos. However, imbued ones are sorcerers who draw their power from one specific energy versus all eight. Imbued ones can trace their bloodlines back to one of three sources: the titans, danaavrakti, or elves. As such, humans and other races not created or related to one of these sources rarely possess the innate ability to wield imbued one magic.
You were born with an innate understanding of magic. You gain proficiency in the Arcana skill. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this skill.

sheet.description: You have experise in arcana.

description.p: Choose one of the arcane energies from the list below. Your imbued one features depend on the chosen energy, as detailed below. You can change your energy source whenever you gain a level in this class. When you change your energy source, you lose the benefits from the energy source out of which you changed.
Abjuration. You can cast mage armor on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

Conjuration. You can cast mage hand at will. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the hand. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the hand up to 30 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.
Divination. You can cast detect magic at will, without expending a spell slot.

Enchantment. When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to force the creature to subtract 2 from the result. You can use this reaction after the roll is made but before the outcome is determined. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Evocation. You can cast eldritch blast at will. This spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you. When you cast eldritch blast using this feature, add your Charisma modifier to the damage it deals on a hit.
Illusion. You can cast disguise self at will, without expending a spell slot.
Necromancy. You can cast false life on yourself at will as a 1st-level spell, without expending a spell slot or material components.

Transmutation. You can cast the prestidigitation cantrip at will. When you use this feature to cast this spell, the duration is until dispelled. As normal, if you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

You can cast false life on yourself at will as a 1st-level spell, without expending a spell slot or material components. As an action, you can touch a humanoid that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute. The creature becomes your undead servant. It is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. The creature uses the Undead Servant stat block below. It uses your proficiency bonus in several places. In combat, the servant acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you have more than one attack when you take the Attack action, you can sacrifice one of your attacks to command the servant to take the Attack action. If you are incapacitated, the servant can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge. If the servant was destroyed within the last hour, you can use your action to touch it and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. The servant returns to life (or unlife, as it were) after 1 minute with all its hit points restored. When you finish a long rest, you can animate a new undead servant targeting a new corpse. If you already have an undead servant from this feature, the previous servant unanimates when the new servant animates. The servant also unaminates if you die.
